title: Which is worse, a threat or a warning? - Quora

response.answer_text: A warning is to let you know that you’re not safe or you’ve done something wrong. It tells you that if you keep acting the way you are, things won’t go your way. Either you’ll be hurt by your own hand, or another will act against you. e.g. If you’re late to school one more time, I’ll have to put you in detention. A threat is to let you know that someone is angry with you, either for their own private reasons or because you provoked them in some way. They’ll act against you, maybe even hurt you, and unlike someone warning they will choose this option before trying to change your mind and actions. e.g. I will find you, and I will kill you. The difference is that one warns of unpleasantness, and the other shows a want to personally cause you unpleasantness.
